name: Paris Loft with Balcony
summary:
Romantic loft in the heart of Paris with a small balcony and glimpses of the Eiffel Tower from nearby streets. 
        Perfect for couples who want to enjoy cafes, galleries, and evening strolls.
        
        

Tucked inside a historic 18th-century building, this sunlit loft captures the romantic charm of Paris with exposed beams, vintage décor, 
        and tall French windows opening onto cobblestone streets. The open kitchen is perfect for preparing a market-fresh breakfast before wandering to the Seine or Picasso Museum just minutes away. 
        
        

The host — a Parisian pastry chef — 
        leaves a welcome basket with local delicacies and a handwritten list of her favorite hidden cafés.

highlights.sub: Small balcony perfect for morning coffee and people-watching.
Walk to many charming neighborhoods and museums.
Comfortable kitchen for weekend brunches and cooking.

host.about: Art lover and baker — I enjoy curating a charming Paris experience for guests. I can recommend the best pastry spots.

reviews.txt: Très charmant ! The loft felt like a small Parisian dream — Élodie left delightful tips.
Great place for a couple — elegant and centrally located.
Lovingly decorated — perfect for a romantic weekend in Paris.

name: Budapest Modern Flat
summary:
Stylish and modern flat in the heart of Budapest, close to cafés, galleries, and the vibrant nightlife of District VII. 

This bright apartment features open-plan living, elegant furnishings, and a cozy workspace. 

Located in a renovated 19th-century building with high ceilings and classic details, blending old charm with new comfort. 

Walking distance to ruin bars, thermal baths, and the Danube promenade — ideal for couples and solo travelers looking to experience authentic Budapest.

highlights.sub: Steps away from Budapest’s famous ruin bars and synagogues.
Modern design in a beautifully restored 19th-century building.
Metro and tram stations within a 3-minute walk.

host.about: Local designer and music lover who enjoys helping guests explore Budapest’s creative side.

reviews.txt: Fantastic location near the ruin bars and metro! The apartment was spotless and comfortable.
Perfect stay for exploring Budapest — loved the mix of history and style. Great host!
Charming, bright, and close to everything. I’d definitely return.

name: Budapest Cozy Loft
summary:
Charming loft apartment in the heart of Budapest’s Jewish Quarter, surrounded by cafés, galleries, and vibrant nightlife. 

This stylish flat blends industrial design with classic Budapest architecture — featuring high ceilings, exposed brick, and plenty of natural light. 

Perfect for a couple or solo traveler looking for a creative space close to the city’s best bars, restaurants, and cultural landmarks. 

A fully equipped kitchenette, comfy bed, and peaceful courtyard views make it a perfect urban retreat.

highlights.sub: Steps from Budapest’s ruin bars, cafés, and culture.
Industrial charm meets cozy design in the heart of Pest.
Close to metro line M2 and trams 4–6 for easy city access.

host.about: Architect and local guide who loves sharing Budapest’s hidden courtyards, thermal baths, and design cafés.

reviews.txt: Beautiful apartment, great location near all the nightlife yet quiet inside.
Stylish and very clean. Anna was an excellent host and helped with local tips.
Loved the design and comfort. Perfect base for exploring Budapest’s center.

name: Budapest Industrial Apartment
summary:
Stylish and modern apartment in Budapest’s District VIII, a neighborhood known for its art spaces and creative vibe. 

This converted industrial loft blends exposed brick, metal accents, and minimalist design for a unique urban atmosphere. 

Enjoy natural light from tall factory-style windows and an open living area with a compact, fully equipped kitchen. 

Perfect for digital nomads or couples looking for a contemporary stay close to cafés, ruin bars, and public transport.

highlights.sub: Surrounded by art galleries, cafés, and local markets.
Exposed brick walls and high ceilings create a modern urban feel.
Minutes from metro lines and tram stops to explore Pest and Buda.

host.about: Interior designer passionate about Budapest’s architectural heritage. I love helping guests discover the city’s creative side.

reviews.txt: Loved the style and quiet location. Easy check-in and close to the metro.
Gabor’s apartment is amazing — stylish, clean, and perfectly located for exploring Pest.
A cozy industrial gem in central Budapest. Perfect for remote work or weekend trips.

name: Budapest Studio with Balcony
summary:
Bright studio apartment with private balcony in central Budapest, steps away from Andrássy Avenue and the Opera House. 

This cozy studio combines modern comfort with historic charm — featuring tall windows, minimalist décor, and a sunny balcony perfect for morning coffee. 

Close to restaurants, cafés, and public transport, it’s an ideal stay for couples or solo travelers exploring the city.

highlights.sub: Enjoy a quiet breakfast with views over Budapest’s rooftops.
Steps from Andrássy Avenue, the Opera, and metro line M1.
Compact yet stylish, with bright interiors and comfort essentials.

host.about: Travel enthusiast and local foodie. I love helping guests experience authentic Budapest and its hidden cafés.

reviews.txt: Perfect little studio — loved the balcony and the location near everything!
Super clean, stylish, and well-equipped. Réka was so kind and responsive.
Cozy and bright — ideal for a few days in Budapest. The balcony was a dream spot!

name: Budapest Elegant Flat near Parliament
summary:
Elegant and modern apartment near the Hungarian Parliament and the Danube River. 

This stylish flat features classic Budapest architecture — high ceilings, tall windows, and elegant furnishings combined with modern comforts. 

Located in District V, you’ll be steps from the river promenade, cafés, and the city’s cultural landmarks. 

Perfect for couples or business travelers looking for a quiet, central home base with timeless charm.

highlights.sub: Moments from Parliament, the Danube, and Chain Bridge.
Classic details with modern touches and soft lighting.
Peaceful residential building in central Pest.

host.about: Architect and lifelong Budapest resident who enjoys showing guests the city’s architecture and riverside beauty.

reviews.txt: Beautiful apartment with classic charm. Walking distance to the river and Parliament.
Spacious, quiet, and beautifully decorated. Bence was a great host with excellent local tips.
The flat was spotless and elegant. Perfect base for sightseeing in central Budapest.

name: Budapest Modern Loft in Jewish Quarter
summary:
Contemporary loft apartment located in Budapest’s lively Jewish Quarter (District VII). 

This open-plan loft features high ceilings, industrial décor, and large windows that fill the space with light. 

Enjoy the stylish living area, fully equipped kitchen, and cozy mezzanine bedroom. 

Surrounded by cafés, restaurants, and the city’s famous ruin bars, this loft is ideal for young couples or solo travelers looking for a modern city vibe.

highlights.sub: Stay steps from the famous ruin bars, restaurants, and local markets.
Modern interiors with high ceilings and open-plan layout.
Short walk to Deák Square, Andrassy Avenue, and metro connections.

host.about: Architect turned host, passionate about modern design and Budapest’s cultural life.

personalFacts.text: Born in Szeged, living in Budapest

reviews.txt: Amazing loft with a great location. Everything was clean and well thought out.
Loved the industrial feel and how close it was to the nightlife. Great host!
Fantastic stay in a cool loft. László was quick to respond and very helpful.

name: Spacious Apartment with Terrace
summary:
Elegant and spacious apartment in Budapest’s peaceful District XIII, featuring a large private terrace overlooking the city rooftops. 

Bright open-plan living room, fully equipped kitchen, and a cozy bedroom make this apartment perfect for a relaxed getaway. 

Located near Margaret Island and the Danube promenade, guests can enjoy both serenity and easy access to downtown attractions. 

Ideal for couples or professionals seeking comfort, light, and space.

highlights.sub: Spacious outdoor space for morning coffee or evening wine.
Close to Margaret Island and the Danube promenade.
Bright living space with soft tones and stylish furniture.

host.about: Interior designer and nature lover. I enjoy helping guests discover the local food scene and hidden green spots along the Danube.

reviews.txt: Absolutely loved the terrace and the peaceful area. The apartment was spotless and stylish.
Kata’s flat was perfect for a quiet weekend in Budapest. The terrace made it even better!
Spacious and beautiful apartment. The host was so kind and gave amazing local tips.

name: Chic Flat near Opera House
summary:
Stylish and bright apartment near Budapest’s Opera House, perfect for travelers who love culture and city life. 

This renovated flat blends chic design with comfort — high ceilings, large windows, and modern finishes. 

Step outside to cafés, boutique stores, and theaters on Andrássy Avenue. 

A great base for exploring the heart of Budapest, whether for work or a weekend escape.

highlights.sub: Minutes from the Opera House and Andrássy Avenue.
Refined design with warm tones and quality finishes.
Cafés, music venues, and metro stations all nearby.

host.about: Cultural manager and theater lover. I enjoy hosting guests who appreciate Budapest’s arts and architecture.

reviews.txt: Perfect location near the Opera and restaurants. Clean, cozy, and beautifully styled.
Lovely apartment and excellent host. Dóra gave us great tips for cafés and shows.
Such a beautiful flat in the center of Budapest. The decor was elegant, and the area felt safe and vibrant.

name: Stylish Studio near Danube Promenade
summary:
Bright and stylish studio located in the heart of Budapest, just steps from the Danube Promenade and Chain Bridge. 

This cozy apartment features modern furnishings, a well-equipped kitchenette, and large windows letting in plenty of natural light. 

Perfect for solo travelers or couples looking to explore the city’s main sights on foot. 

You’ll find cafés, restaurants, and public transport all within a short walk from the apartment.

highlights.sub: Steps from the Danube and Budapest’s main attractions.
Stylish décor with a warm, homey atmosphere.
Minutes from metro lines, cafés, and restaurants.

host.about: Local host who loves architecture, coffee, and good design. I enjoy sharing Budapest’s hidden gems with guests.

personalFacts.text: Born in Pécs, now living in Budapest

reviews.txt: Perfect little studio in the center of Budapest. Clean, quiet, and had everything I needed.
Super location and Ádám was an excellent host. The studio is stylish and cozy — perfect for two.
Loved staying here! The flat was spotless and very close to everything. Highly recommend.

name: Contemporary Loft with Exposed Brick
summary:
Stylish open-plan loft apartment in Budapest’s historic Palace Quarter. 

Set in a renovated 19th-century building, this airy loft combines exposed brick walls, high ceilings, and contemporary furniture. 

Natural light floods the space, highlighting unique architectural details. 

Cafés, galleries, and the National Museum are just a short walk away — ideal for guests who love history, culture, and modern comfort.

highlights.sub: Exposed brick and tall windows in a historic building.
Tucked in a peaceful street close to the National Museum.
Stylish open-plan layout with designer furnishings.

host.about: Architect and art lover. I enjoy restoring old buildings and helping guests experience the creative side of Budapest.

personalFacts.text: From Szeged, now living in Budapest

reviews.txt: Loved the design and atmosphere. The brick walls and lighting made it feel special. Excellent location too!
Fantastic loft! Comfortable bed, well-equipped kitchen, and great neighborhood vibe. Would stay again.
Such a cool space! The exposed brick gives it so much character, and everything was spotless.
